summary: TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2012 HYUNDAI GENESIS. THE CONTACT STATED THAT WHILE DRIVING AT 20 MPH WITH THE ACCELERATOR PEDAL DEPRESSED WHILE MAKING A RIGHT OR LEFT TURN, THE VEHICLE STALLED WITH ALL THE WARNING LIGHTS ILLUMINATED. THE VEHICLE WAS ABLE TO RESTART AFTER THE FIRST ATTEMPT. THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO LOCAL DEALER (MODERN HYUNDAI OF CONCORD, 965 CONCORD PKWY S, CONCORD, NC, 28027) WHERE THEY WERE UNABLE TO DUPLICATE THE FAILURE, NOR RETRIEVE ERROR CODES FROM THE SYSTEM. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE, INFORMED THE CONTACT THAT THEY WERE AWARE OF THE FAILURE, AND REFERRED THE CONTACT TO NHTSA TO FILE A COMPLAINT. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 35,000.
